item.title: bought some puzzles
item.description: 18:17 Saturday 16 December 2017 I bought five puzzles today after seeing some that I had had as a kid. The woman at the shop suggested four as being difficult, and I selected a fifth one because I liked its design.

item.title: toy store
item.description: 18:17 Tuesday 08 December 2015 JST Each week for the past few weeks I have solved the Rubick’s Pyramid (it’s very easy), and relinked the rings for any unlink ring-link puzzles. Today I also solved the pyramid-shaped wooden puzzle. The pieces don’t “link” at all, so its challenge is basically something like each piece looks like it could be a corner piece. They’ve got a lot of Christmas themed items which are more decorative than interesting for me, but blah I guess it’s about to be Christmas in some places, so fine.

item.title: Toy store has new puzzles
item.description: 18:34 Tuesday 06 October 2015 JST The best new puzzle was a wooden chain like a bicycle chain except some of its links were fixed, as if they were rusty and wouldn’t rotate, except they were actually uncut pieces of wood. Apparently, it’s possible to arrange the chain on a tree shaped board so that all the links exactly cover the tree, including one at the bottom for the trunk.

item.title: Tweaked the Zebra puzzle
item.description: 17:35 Sunday 23 August 2015 JST The Zebra Puzzle features brand names of unhealthy products, so I changed them into less-unhealthy food items. I haven’t tried to solve it yet, but here’s my tweaked version: There are five houses, nationalities, pets, favorite foods, and favorite drinks: The Englishman lives in the red house. The Spaniard owns the dog. Coffee is drunk in the green house. The Ukrainian drinks tea.
